DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging FerriScan Liver Iron Concentration Unit of Measure
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._A proprietary method to determine liver iron concentration through an MRI-based imaging technology that uses R2-MRI relaxometry._A measurement of the concentration of iron in the liver as an estimate of body iron load._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._A proprietary method to determine liver iron concentration through an MRI-based imaging technology that uses R2-MRI relaxometry.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (mag-NET-ik REZ-o-nans IM-a-jing) MRI. A procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body.  Also called nuclear magnetic resonance imaging.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Liver Iron Concentration Unit of Measure
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A measurement of the concentration of iron in the liver as an estimate of body iron load._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gram Iron per kilogram liver (Dry Weight)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gram Iron per kilogram liver (Dry Weight)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measurement of iron in the liver expressed as a ratio of grams of iron to kilograms of dry weight of the liver sample.

Concepts.longName: Gram Iron per kilogram liver (Dry Weight)
Concepts.definition: A measurement of iron in the liver expressed as a ratio of grams of iron to kilograms of dry weight of the liver sample.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Milligram Iron per Gram Liver (Dry Weight)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Milligram Iron per Gram Liver (Dry Weight)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measurement of iron in the liver expressed as a ratio to the dry weight of the liver sample.

Concepts.longName: Milligram Iron per Gram Liver (Dry Weight)
Concepts.definition: A measurement of iron in the liver expressed as a ratio of milligrams of iron to grams of dry weight of the liver sample.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Micromole Iron per Gram Liver (Dry Weight)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Micromole Iron per Gram Liver (Dry Weight)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measurement of iron in the liver expressed as a ratio of grams of iron to kilograms of dry weight of the liver sample.

Concepts.longName: Micromole Iron per Gram Liver (Dry Weight)
Concepts.definition: A measurement of iron in the liver expressed as a ratio of micromoles of iron to grams of dry weight of the liver sample.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Magnetic resonance imaging (M
ReferenceDocuments.description: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is used to determine the concentration of iron in the liver and provides references for quantifying liver iron by Ferriscan (MRI R2).
